dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 6676 IH: Protecting Parental Rights Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Herrera Beutler (for herself, Mr. Harris, Mr. Fleischmann, Mrs. Cammack, Mr. Johnson of South Dakota, Mr. Bacon, Mr. Tiffany, Mr. Rodney Davis of Illinois, Mr. Ferguson, Mr. Stauber, and Mr. Latta) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit administering COVID–19 vaccines to minors without parental consent, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Parental Rights Act.

section.header: Administering COVID–19 vaccines to minors without parental consent

subsection.text: Chapter 7 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Administering COVID–19 vaccines to minors without parental consent
section.text: Whoever, in or affecting interstate or foreign commerce, administers a COVID–19 vaccine to an individual who has not attained the age of 18 without the prior consent of a custodial parent or legal guardian of that individual, shall be fined under this title, imprisoned not more than 1 year, or both.

subsection.text: The table of sections for chapter 7 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by inserting after the item related to section 119 the following:

toc.toc-entry: 120. Administering COVID–19 vaccines to minors without parental consent.
